isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 7 Engine Service Manual - Cylinder Head and Valve Train - Installation - Cylinder Heads

note.para: Cam followers cannot be removed or replaced when cylinder head is bolted to the crankcase. Be sure to complete required work on cam followers before installing cylinder head.

step1.para: For left cylinder head, install lifting eye and two flat countersunk screws. Tighten screws to special torque .
For right cylinder head, install lifting eye and two M10 x 25 bolts. Tighten bolts to special torque .

figure.caption: Cylinder head spring dowel pins in crankcase (typical)

step1.para: Install two spring dowel pins in upper crankcase assembly.

figure.caption: Clearance holes for spring dowel pins (typical)

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields to protect eyes. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, clean and blow dry threads in the crankcase bolt holes with filtered compressed air. Dirt or oil in holes may cause binding or an incorrect torque reading.

To prevent engine damage, remove debris from cylinder head. If debris is not removed, a faulty seal between the cylinder head and gasket will cause oil, coolant, and compression leaks. Do not apply sealant to head gasket surfaces.
To prevent engine damage, install a new cylinder head gasket with part number facing up.

note.para: Use care to avoid scratching blue compound on cylinder head gaskets.

step1.para: Align a new cylinder head gasket with spring dowel pins and press to install.

figure.caption: Installation of cylinder head lifting bracket (typical)

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, mount cylinder head lifting bracket on center of cylinder head. Also, make sure the lifting hook has a safety latch.

step1.para:
Install Cylinder Head Lifting Bracket ZTSE4535
and four bolts on center of cylinder head (if removed). Tighten lifting bracket mounting bolts.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not drop or slide cylinder head on head gasket. This will damage the head gasket and spring dowel pins, resulting in leakage.

step1.para: Attach lifting hoist hook or lifting sling to lifting bracket. Raise cylinder head and align with dowel sleeves previously installed in crankcase.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, install new head bolts. Lightly lubricate new bolt threads and mating surfaces of bolt flanges with clean engine oil. Too much oil will cause hydrostatic lock and give incorrect torque reading.
To prevent engine damage, lubricate threads of new cylinder head bolts with clean engine oil. Do not use anti-seize compounds, grease or other lubricants. This will cause an incorrect torque reading.

step1.para: Install and finger tighten 10 cylinder head bolts and five M8 x 70 bolts.
Remove four lifting bracket bolts and cylinder head lifting bracket.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, use only permanent ink markers to identify bolt torque orientation.

note.para: For proper cylinder head surface seating and sealing, follow the correct tightening sequence.

step1.para: Tighten the cylinder head bolts according to the following steps:

item.para: Tighten cylinder head bolts numbered 1 through 10 to 95 N·m (70 lbf·ft) in numerical sequence.
Loosen cylinder head bolts numbered 1 through 10 in numerical sequence.
Tighten cylinder head bolts numbered 1 through 10 to 156 N·m (115 lbf·ft) in numerical sequence.
Rotate cylinder head bolts numbered 1 through 10 an additional 90° (1/4 turn) clockwise in numerical sequence.
Rotate cylinder head bolts numbered 1 through 10 another 90° (1/4 turn) clockwise in numerical sequence.
Tighten M8 x 70 cylinder head bolts numbered 11 through 15 to 24 N·m (18 lbf·ft).
Tighten M8 x 70 cylinder head bolts numbered 11 through 15 to 31 N·m (23 lbf·ft).
